Title: N/A

reviewText: Luckily my local retailer shelved this item a week early so I already have it.The stunts and clips on this are really some of the best the show had to offer and it was nothing short of tragic that they were left off of the boxed set.  I am of the opinion that the boxed set was really poorly done in that it should have been episodic rather than just 3 conglomerations of edited down stunts and skits.That being said I am really glad that some of these gems are finally on DVD.  The original "Satan vs. God" is presented in all its uncensored (read unbleeped) glory.  Knoxville breaking his ankle trying to jump the "LA river" on rollerskates is included and uncensored.  "Self Defense Test"  "Milk Challenge".  All are slices of fried gold.  The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars from me is that this material should have been released on the boxed set.Bottom line is if you are a fan This is an absolute MUST have to complete the series.
summary: Should have been on the boxed set
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Jackass franchise is dead.In this mind-numbing collage of snippets and out takes from earlier segments, you're treated to endless scenes of non-stop vomitting, people having bowel movements and--oh, you know, the usual things that we just can'tlive without. I fast-forwarded most of this junk and closed my eyes during all the vomitting and bowel movements scenes.You know this is a Jackass Production because everytime a scene is shown, there is wild, screams of hysterical laughing. Yoc can easily imagine the old gang of aging pranksters to be rolling around on the ground in helpless hysteria. Too bad the viewer isn't doing the same thing.None of these scenes were deemed worthy enough to include in the original programs and they're grade Z garbage to be included here.My very favorite bad boy, Chris Pontius, was given very little to do. I could watch him all day.What was really outrageous is that MTV included all these scenes of bodily functions graphically with nothing hidden.Yet, when some of the guys were photographed from behind with their naked tushes on display, the cleft division was digitally hidden! How crazy is that? Would showing their butt crack turned us all into raving lunatics? Or shocked us? It'd be so great that one day we could see our favorite badboys--especially Chris--completly nude.

reviewText: Some great stuff in this package.  I'm a longtime fan of Jackass, and so I've tried to just collect everything they put out, but this might not be a great jumping off point or a good purchase for an idle fan.
summary: More of the Same, But That's Not Exactly Bad

reviewText: Well, I want to start by saying this little DVD is so funny. It has over 2 hours of Jackass skits not released on the box sets. That is unfortunate. Basically, these should be called the Unreleased Tapes.One complaint: the original version of the Self Defense skit had Knoxville putting on a bulletproof vest and shooting himself. Why is that not here?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found this DVD to pretty much be a rerun of their first season.  I know there was some hang up with the first season footage, and this seems to have "fixed" it.  There were some funny things on there, but I had seem them already.  Some of those included:RugbyThe Milk ChallengePontious as SatanSkateboard WheelNight MonkeySelf DefenseStun CollarFastfood FootballAlso, the guys jumped into A Lot of bushes, which had been done to death in the first season.  I was really disappointed because this is billed as new material and it's not.Another thing that pulled it down for me was that these were the early skits where they didn't really have editing down.  The funny parts were present, but so was all the dead air before and after.  Yes, there were some funny things in this DVD, and if you're a fan it's for you, but this isn't one I'd buy.  Renting it and seeing it once was good enough.
Title: N/A
